name: Barbecue: Brisket
description: Each week Joshua Bousel of The Meatwave drops by with a recipe for you to grill over the weekend. Fire it up, Joshua! [Photograph: Joshua Bousel] My appetite for large pieces of meat seems to increase with the colder weather....
recipeIngredient: About 1 cup of of your favorite dry rub
8 large chunks of your favorite smoking wood (I like a mix of oak and apple)

recipeInstructions.text: Trim the brisket of hard and excess fat, leaving 1/4-inch layer of fat along the top. Coat brisket liberally in your favorite dry rub and then wrap in heave duty aluminum foil. Place in the refrigerator and let it sit for 8 hours up to one day.
Fire up your smoker between 215 to 225°F. At the chunks of wood, and when they begin to smoke, remove the brisket from the foil and place in the smoker.

Cook the brisket between 215 to 225°F until an instant read thermometer reads 165°F in the flat section of the brisket, about 10 to 12 hours. Wrap the brisket in heavy duty aluminum foil and put back into the smoker. Continue cooking until the point section of the brisket registers 195°F, about 4 to 6 hours more. Remove from the smoker, let rest at least 30 minutes, then slice and serve.
